21.1 Accounts Management and Compliance Services Operations
The purpose of the IRM

, Customer Account Services, is to provide tions to resolve taxpayer correspondence, telephone, and in person This includes identifying compliance issues and issuing correspondence to adjust tax accounts. Many parts of the IRM, including all of Part

SERP is a living product and, as such, is constantly in the process of being updated and appended. All reference material/information marked as Official Use Only (OUO) be kept in a secure area, such as a locked ﬁle cabinet, when not in use. Never leave SERP OUO material visible if you are away from your monitor. Employees in the following functional areas must use this IRM: • Adjustments • Automated Collection System (ACS) (only IRM

) The purpose of the IRM

, Customer Account Services, is to provide instruc- tions to resolve taxpayer correspondence, telephone, and in person inquiries. This includes identifying compliance issues and issuing correspondence to adjust tax accounts. Many parts of the IRM, including all of Part

, available on the Servicewide Electronic Research Program (SERP), accessed through the IRS Intranet Homepage. Most of the other referenced research materials are available on SERP and as published paper products. SERP is a living product and, as such, is constantly in the process of being updated and appended.

Accounts Management and Compliance Operations (

) Before submission, re-examine the requested change(s) and cite documentation. Be speciﬁc. Avoid the use of general terms such as revise procedures. Submit only one issue/topic on the SERP Feedback. (
) Complete all required ﬁelds on the SERP Feedback form. The ﬁeld MUST be completed, or the feedback will not be forwarded. (

) All changes are considered, but all may not be accepted. Accepted are usually posted on SERP as IRM Procedural Updates (IPUs). • IPUs are announced in “Today’s News” on the SERP Homepage. • Each IPU is assigned a number and identiﬁes the intended and applicable Master File. • Access previous IPUs via SERP through the IRM Procedural link under the IRM Supplements Tab. • Numbering of IPUs is completed consecutively through the calendar year. • Maintenance of IPUs is on the current IRM until a new IRM is lished and effective. (
) You can view responses to SERP Feedbacks via the “Feedback” link at the top of the left hand column of the SERP homepage or with the “Feedback” button located at the top of most IRM pages. (
) Do NOT use the SERP Feedback form to request changes to the • Forms - see IRM
, Publishing Systems and Programs, for tions • Letters - see IRM
, Request for New and Revised Correspondence Products - Request Services Process • Notices - see IRM
, Request for New and Revised Correspondence Products - Request Services Process • Policy statements, tax law, and regulations - Use existing (
) Changes for typographical, printing errors in text or procedure and/or changes must be made via SERP Feedback. (

) Information that may impact employees service-wide, but does not require IRM procedural update, is placed on SERP as a “SERP Alert”. • Each Alert is assigned a number and identiﬁes the (BOD) and the intended audience. Alerts • Numbering of alerts is completed consecutively through the year. • Access previous Alerts via the Alert Messages link under the IRM Supplements Tab. • Access previous year’s Alerts through Previous News Finder. (

) Some examples of SERP Alerts: • Reminders to follow certain existing procedures. • “Hot” issues - e.g., scams, schemes, processing errors, new tax tion, erroneous and/or one time notices, etc. • Non-IRM related issues - e.g., changes to job aids, ITLA, etc. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

Accounts Management and Compliance Services Operations
Complete all required ﬁelds on the SERP Feedback form. The Identiﬁcation ﬁeld MUST be completed, or the feedback will not be forwarded.
All changes are considered, but all may not be accepted. Accepted changes are usually posted on SERP as IRM Procedural Updates (IPUs).
Information that may impact employees service-wide, but does not require an IRM procedural update, is placed on SERP as a “SERP Alert”.

Each Alert is assigned a number and identiﬁes the (BOD) and the intended audience. Numbering of alerts is completed consecutively through the calendar year. Access previous Alerts via the Alert Messages link under the IRM Supplements Tab. Access previous year’s Alerts through Previous News Finder.
IRMs needed to perform your official duties: IRM

- Servicewide Policies and Authorities -Division Delegations of Authority for Wage and Investment - All existing authorities by the Commissioner, Deputy Commissioners, Taxpayer Advocate Service, and the business operating divisions. IRM

- Inter-center - Provides information regarding the Technology (IT) operational functions between the IRS Campuses (IRSCs) and Enterprise Computing Centers (ECCs). These guidelines are for the IT staff that performs operational functions in IRS National Headquarters, User and Network Services, and Enterprise Computing Centers. IRM
- “Oral” Statement/Telephone Contact Address Change Requirements for MFJ Accounts - Instructions on address changes. IRM
- IRS Individual Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number (ITIN) Real Time System (RTS) - Provides instructions for Form W-
, Applica- tion for IRS Individual Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number. IRM
- Physical Security Program - Security guidelines for tax mation and property that requires more than “normal protection” disclosure, loss, damage or destruction. IRM
- Disclosure of Official Information - Instructions, guidelines, and procedures to comply with the disclosure laws under which IRS must operate. IRM
-Taxpayer Advocate Case Procedures - Guidance for the Taxpayer Advocate Service. IRM
- Penalty Handbook - Instructions to compute, assess, and abate penalties. IRM
- Interest - Instructions to compute and assess interest. IRM
- Taxpayer Contacts - Incoming and Outgoing Correspondence/Letters - Instructions to receive, prepare, and handle correspondence.

Accounts Management and Compliance Services Operations
The TTG is designed to assist you in making the correct decision when you must transfer a call to another application on Aspect.
The TTG is located on the SERP Intranet site and is self-explanatory.
In addition to POD addresses the following contact information, while not all inclusive, can also be found in the Post of Duty (POD) List:
EIN assignment
Insolvency
Installment Agreement
Lien Payoff/Release

TAS Use TCDs in conjunction with the IRM when you respond to telephone, person, and paper inquiries. TCDs condense IRM procedures and consolidate technical information the IRM and various other sources such as the ITLA and IRS TCDs use plain language and create an easy to use, one

page mat to help you resolve issues quickly. Designed to follow the ﬂow of a er’s inquiry. TCDs provide hyperlinks to the IRM, ITLA, IRS publications, related topics, and other references. You can locate TCDs on the Intranet via SERP under the IRM tab (see Technical Communication Documents), or by selecting the on the left side of the SERP Homepage. A wide variety of TCD topics can be found under the following
Account Resolution
Authentication and Disclosure
Balance Due and Installment Agreements
Credits and Deductions
Delinquent Filers
e
File
EIN
Filing Information
Identity Theft
International
TCDs condense IRM procedures and consolidate technical information from the IRM and various other sources such as the ITLA and IRS Publications.
• Penalty • Refund • Statute • Taxpayer Protection Program (TPP) • Transfers and Referrals (
) It is highly recommended that you use TCDs when you respond to account inquiries on the telephone. It is also recommended that you use them for in- person and paper inquiries.

- Electronic Tax Administration - An overview of the Filing Program.

- Accounting and Data Control - Excess Collections File - Provides technical instructions to be used by Accounting Technicians when receiving and adding records to the Excess Collections File (XSF). IRM
- Accounting and Data Control - Miscellaneous - Provides information for campus Accounting Branch to process quick, prompt, and jeopardy assessments. IRM
- Accounting and Data Control - Electronic Payments - Provides information for Ogden Submission Processing Center ing Branch to operate the Electronic Federal Tax Payment System (EFTPS).
The following IRMs provide instructions for processing international tax returns.
• IRM
- Non-Master File (NMF) Adjustments - Used by IRS employees to process International NMF adjustments and instructions on ﬁling Form
–IC_DISC, Interest Charge Domestic International Sales - Corporation Return. • IRM
- International - IMF International Adjustments - Used by Tax Examiners, CSRs and Taxpayer Resolution Representatives (TRRs) in Accounts Management to process International IMF adjustments. • IRM
- International - BMF International Adjustments - Used by Tax Examiners, CSRs and TRRs in Accounts Management to process International BMF adjustments.
The following IRMs provide instructions for securing delinquent returns and assisting with balance due inquiries.
IRM 5.19.1 - Balance Due - Provides procedures for campus processing ″ ″ ″ ″ ″ of balance due accounts where Can’t Pay , Won’t Pay and Will Pay ″ Later have been indicated by the taxpayer.
IRM 5.19.2 - Liability Collection - Individual Master File (IMF) Return Delinquency - Contains information for working returns delinquency responses in Compliance Services and Accounts Management.
